org.rendersnake.error

Class RenderException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • org.rendersnake.error.RenderException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Renderable

    public class RenderException
extends RuntimeException
implements Renderable
    RenderException is a RuntimeException that is thrown in the following cases
  • sending close() when there is no open tag
  • sending close(someTag) where otherTag was expected
  • general exception occurred when rendering a component
Author:
ernest
See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • nullTag

        public static RenderException nullTag()
        Return a new RenderException for the situation that a different tag is being close than expected. This indicates that a required close tag was not sent.
        Parameters:
        expected - , what should have been the close tag
        actual - , what the program is trying to close
        Returns:

      • unexpectedTag

        public static RenderException unexpectedTag(String expected,
                            String actual)
        Return a new RenderException for the situation that a different tag is being close than expected. This indicates that a required close tag was not sent.
        Parameters:
        expected - , what should have been the close tag
        actual - , what the program is trying to close
        Returns:
